purpleculture_pinyin:
diān
top (of the head); apex; to fall forwards; inverted; to jolt
верх (из головы); вершина; падать вперед; перевернутый; встряхнуть
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 颠)
Pictophonetic: 真 indicates the sound; 頁 (head) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
顛倒 [ diān dǎo ]: to turn upside down; to reverse; back to front; confused; deranged; crazy
顛簸 [ diān bǒ ]: to shake; to jolt; to bump
顛覆 [ diān fù ]: to topple (i.e. knock over); to capsize; fig. to overturn (a regime, by plotting or subversion); to undermine; to subvert
顛倒黑白 [ diān dǎo hēi bái ]: lit. to invert black and white (idiom); to distort the truth deliberately; to misrepresent the facts; to invert right and wrong
顛撲不破 [ diān pū bù pò ]: solid; irrefutable; incontrovertible; indisputable; unbreakable
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 真 [ zhēn ] real, actual, true, genuine
    • 頁 [ yè ] page, sheet, leaf
heisig_chinese_memo: You truly know your friend's head so no matter the position, inverted or otherwise, you still know it's him.
Ru_Radicals: ハ, 十 (десять), 目 (глаз), 貝 (раковина), 頁 (страница)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the page (頁) with the truth (真) can overturn
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A good way to get someone to tell the truth is to invert their body so their head is upside down and filling with blood.
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle inverted human form, see the "collection" 18446, meteorite is Britain's " Britain ideographic beginning of the text", that is, "Wen said," " exterminate " the classical. (Tang Lan, Qiu Xigui, Chen Jian, Jiang Yubin) Oracle bone inscriptions are mostly in the form of " fu ", " people " or " zi ", which means that people have fallen from Fu. Down below the " zi " or add a " ding " sound. Huayuanzhuang Dongdi oracle bones are also written from " Fu " to " Jie " (a kneeling human figure). The character shape of " Ri " is also a variant of " Dian ". (Jiang Yubin)

Bronze text from " page ", " true " sound. Xiaozhuan follows it. Chu from the Department of a word and " mortar " ( " Kan "), " true " sound shape. From "凵" means upside down to "凵" or upside down because of "凵". See "Tsinghua III. "Liang Chen" should be a variant of " Bang ". (Xie Mingwen)

The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the original meaning, such as "Compilation" 10405: "Ziyang is also overturned." It means that Ziyang also fell from the car. Another example is "Collection" 18789: "Nine days [Eight rabbits], Xin □ 㞢 (have) 𡿧 (disaster), Wang Dian from..." means the ninth day of the king from the day of divination. ) Something bad happened, and the king (self-car or somewhere) fell down. (Xie Mingwen)

The inscription " Dian " or " Ding " is pronounced " Ding ", which matches the word " Dagger ". He Linyi thinks that " Bian " should mean top, and "Yudian" refers to the head of the fish, here it refers to the oval head of the dagger.

An example of the original meaning of " Dian " in ancient books is like "The Analects. "Ji Shi": "Danger without holding on, but not supporting." "Chu Ci. Chapter Nine. "Thinking Beauty": "The car is overthrown and the horse is overwhelmed, and Jian has this strange road alone."

" Britain " means reversed, upside down. Such as "Poetry. Qi Feng. "The East Is Unknown": "The East Is Unknown, Upside Down Clothes." "Chu Ci. Nine sighs. Stunned": "Today, I think it's the inside, but I think it's clothes." The extension means destruction. Such as "Mencius. "Wan Zhang Shang": "Tai Jia subverts Tang's punishment, Yi Yin puts it in Tong."

" Bian " is often used to educate " top " in ancient books to mean the top of the head. "Er Ya. "Interpretation": "Dian, top also." Such as "Poetry. Qin Feng. "Car Neighbor": "If there is a car, there is a horse." The extension means the top. Such as "Historical Records. "Xiaowu Benji": "East to Mount Tai, where the grass and leaves of the mountain have not grown, it is the summit of Mount Tai that makes people stand on stone."

(Tang Lan, Qiu Xigui, Chen Jian, Jiang Yubin) Oracle bone inscriptions are mostly in the form of " fu ", " people " or " zi ", which means that people have fallen from Fu.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文有倒人形，見《合集》18446，是顛隕的「顛」的表意初文，亦即《說文》「殄」的古文。（唐蘭、裘錫圭、陳劍、蔣玉斌）甲骨文多作從「阜」從倒「人」或倒「子」之形，表示人從阜上顛落。倒「子」之下或增「丁」聲。花園莊東地甲骨又寫作從「阜」從倒「卩」（跪坐人形），「日」聲的字形，也是「顛」的異體。（蔣玉斌）

　　金文從「頁」，「真」聲。小篆從之。戰國楚系文字又有從「臼」（「凵」），「真」聲的字形。從「凵」表示顛倒於「凵」或因「凵」而顛倒。字形見《清華叄．良臣》，應即「顛」的異體。（謝明文）

　　甲骨文用作本義，如《合集》10405正：「子央亦顛。」意謂子央也從車上顛隕下來。又如《合集》18789：「九日[八兔]，辛□㞢（有）𡿧（災），王顛自…」意謂王自占卜之日算起的第九天（此日天干為辛）發生了不好的事情，這一天王（自車或某處）顛落。（謝明文）

　　金文「顛」或讀為「鼎」，與「匕」相配，字形見戰國魚顛匕。何琳儀以為「顛」應表示頂，「魚顛」指魚頭，在此指匕的橢圓形頭部。

　　「顛」在古書中表示本義的例子如《論語．季氏》：「危而不持，顛而不扶。」《楚辭．九章．思美人》：「車既覆而馬顛兮，蹇獨懷此異路。」

　　「顛」表示顛倒、倒置。如《詩．齊風．東方未明》：「東方未明，顛倒衣裳。」《楚辭．九嘆．愍命》：「今反表以為裏兮，顛裳以為衣。」引申表示破壞。如《孟子．萬章上》：「太甲顛覆湯之典刑，伊尹放之於桐。」

　　「顛」在古書中常與「頂」互訓，表示頭頂。《爾雅．釋言》：「顛，頂也。」如《詩．秦風．車鄰》：「有車鄰鄰，有馬白顛。」引申表示頂端。如《史記．孝武本紀》：「東上泰山，山之草木葉未生，乃令人上石立之泰山顛。」「泰山顛」即泰山之頂。
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文有倒人形，見《合集》18446，是顛隕的「顛」的表意初文，亦即《說文》「殄」的古文。（唐蘭、裘錫圭、陳劍、蔣玉斌）甲骨文多作從「阜」從倒「人」或倒「子」之形，表示人從阜上顛落。
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
顛 (Simplified: 颠)
Pinyin: diān
English Definition: top (of the head); apex; to fall forwards; inverted; to jolt
Total strokes: 19; Radical: 頁
Pictophonetic: 真 indicates the sound; 頁 (head) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 真 [ zhēn ] real, actual, true, genuine
    • 頁 [ yè ] page, sheet, leaf
Example Words:
顛倒 [ diān dǎo ]: to turn upside down; to reverse; back to front; confused; deranged; crazy
顛簸 [ diān bǒ ]: to shake; to jolt; to bump
顛覆 [ diān fù ]: to topple (i.e. knock over); to capsize; fig. to overturn (a regime, by plotting or subversion); to undermine; to subvert
顛倒黑白 [ diān dǎo hēi bái ]: lit. to invert black and white (idiom); to distort the truth deliberately; to misrepresent the facts; to invert right and wrong
顛撲不破 [ diān pū bù pò ]: solid; irrefutable; incontrovertible; indisputable; unbreakable
More: 顛* | *顛 | *顛*

dian1
HSK 6: 颠,顛
(Simplified: 颠)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 真 indicates the sound; 頁 (head) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 真 [ zhēn ] real, actual, true, genuine
    • 頁 [ yè ] page, sheet, leaf
①頭頂：華顛。
②最高最初的部分：顛末(本末)。山顛。
③傾倒，跌：顛沛。顛倒(dǎo)。顛躓。顛覆。顛撲不破。
④上下跳動：顛簸。
⑤古同“癲”，精神錯亂。
顛倒 [ diān dǎo ]: to turn upside down; to reverse; back to front; confused; deranged; crazy
顛簸 [ diān bǒ ]: to shake; to jolt; to bump
顛覆 [ diān fù ]: to topple (i.e. knock over); to capsize; fig. to overturn (a regime, by plotting or subversion); to undermine; to subvert
顛倒黑白 [ diān dǎo hēi bái ]: lit. to invert black and white (idiom); to distort the truth deliberately; to misrepresent the facts; to invert right and wrong
顛撲不破 [ diān pū bù pò ]: solid; irrefutable; incontrovertible; indisputable; unbreakable
(Simplified: 颠)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 真 indicates the sound; 頁 (head) conveys the meaning.

Kanshudo mnemonic:the page (頁) with the truth (真) can overturn
Chinese: You truly know your friend's head so no matter the position, inverted or otherwise, you still know it's him.  
Meaning: invert
Hanzi: 颠
Story: A good way to get someone to tell the truth is to invert their body so their head is upside down and filling with blood.
Kind: traditional

甲骨文有倒人形，見《合集》18446，是顛隕的「 顛 」的表意初文，亦即《說文》「 殄 」的古文。（唐蘭、裘錫圭、陳劍、蔣玉斌）甲骨文多作從「 阜 」從倒「 人 」或倒「 子 」之形，表示人從阜上顛落。倒「 子 」之下或增「 丁 」聲。花園莊東地甲骨又寫作從「 阜 」從倒「 卩 」（跪坐人形），「 日 」聲的字形，也是「 顛 」的異體。（蔣玉斌） 金文從「 頁 」，「 真 」聲。小篆從之。戰國楚系文字又有從「 臼 」（「 凵 」），「 真 」聲的字形。從「 凵 」表示顛倒於「 凵 」或因「 凵 」而顛倒。字形見《清華叄．良臣》，應即「 顛 」的異體。（謝明文） 甲骨文用作本義，如《合集》10405正：「子央亦顛。」意謂子央也從車上顛隕下來。又如《合集》18789：「九日[八兔]，辛□㞢（有）𡿧（災），王顛自…」意謂王自占卜之日算起的第九天（此日天干為辛）發生了不好的事情，這一天王（自車或某處）顛落。（謝明文） 金文「 顛 」或讀為「 鼎 」，與「 匕 」相配，字形見戰國魚顛匕。何琳儀以為「 顛 」應表示頂，「魚顛」指魚頭，在此指匕的橢圓形頭部。 「 顛 」在古書中表示本義的例子如《論語．季氏》：「危而不持，顛而不扶。」《楚辭．九章．思美人》：「車既覆而馬顛兮，蹇獨懷此異路。」 「 顛 」表示顛倒、倒置。如《詩．齊風．東方未明》：「東方未明，顛倒衣裳。」《楚辭．九嘆．愍命》：「今反表以為裏兮，顛裳以為衣。」引申表示破壞。如《孟子．萬章上》：「太甲顛覆湯之典刑，伊尹放之於桐。」 「 顛 」在古書中常與「 頂 」互訓，表示頭頂。《爾雅．釋言》：「顛，頂也。」如《詩．秦風．車鄰》：「有車鄰鄰，有馬白顛。」引申表示頂端。如《史記．孝武本紀》：「東上泰山，山之草木葉未生，乃令人上石立之泰山顛。」「泰山顛」即泰山之頂。

顛字的基本解释

顛
diān
见“颠”。

顛字的汉语字典释义

[①]［diān］
［《廣韻》都年切，平先，端。］
“颠1”的繁体字。亦作“顚1”。
(1)头顶；头。
(2)顶端，上端。
(3)本，始。
(4)倒仆。
(5)下。
(6)坠落。
(7)颠倒；倒置。
(8)倾覆；灭亡。
(9)颠簸；震荡。
(10)指不平稳地行进；蹦跳着跑。
(11)癫狂，疯癫。后作“癲”。
(12)狂暴，猛烈。
(13)胡闹，狂闹。
(14)掂，掂量。
(15)踮起。
(16)通“滇”。参见“顛歌”。
(17)通“齻”。参见“顛齒”。
(18)姓。春秋晋有颠颉。见《左传·僖公二十三年》。
[②]［tián］
［《集韻》亭年切，平定，定。］
“颠2”的繁体字。亦作“顚2”。
(1)见“顛2顛”。
(2)通“闐”。充满。参见“顛2實”。
[③]［tiàn］
亦作“顚3”。

顛字的康熙字典解释

【戌集下】【頁字部】　顛； 康熙笔画：19； 页码：页1408第06
【正字通】俗顚字。

顛字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
顛字的起名意思

暂无。

diān

Bump
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［diān］
["Guangyun" is cut every year, level first, end. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "湯1". Also known as "顚1".
(1) The top of the head; the head.
(2) Top, top.
(3) This, the beginning.
(4) Downfall.
(5) Next.
(6) Falling.
(7) Upside down; upside down.
(8) Overturn; perish.
(9) Bumps; shocks.
(10) Refers to traveling unevenly; jumping and running.
(11) Crazy, crazy. Later called "epilepsy".
(12) Furious and violent.
(13) Random, frantic.
(14) Weigh, weigh.
(15) Stand on tiptoe.
(16) Through "Dian". See "Biange".
(17) Through "齻". See "Bumped Teeth".
(18) Last name. In the Spring and Autumn Period, there is a jie. See "Twenty-Three Years of Zuo Zhuan·Xi Gong".
[②]［tián］
["Jiyun" pavilion cuts, calms, and sets. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "湯2". Also known as "Xiao 2".
(1) See "Dian 2 Dian".
(2) Through "Tian". full. See "Ban 2 Real".
[③]［tiàn］
Also known as "顚3".

ハ, 十 (десять), 目 (глаз), 貝 (раковина), 頁 (страница)
